body: I'd like to take this issue @edgchen1 can you guide as to what should be the next steps.

> I'd like to take this issue @edgchen1 can you guide as to what should be the next steps.

@SauravMaheshkar Sure, in general: familiarize yourself with the relevant code, make the change (including documentation and tests as appropriate), and submit a PR.

There are several scopes at which to set log levels: environment (global), session (multiple sessions per environment), and run (multiple runs per session).

There are also two different log levels: log severity and log verbosity. Log severity is the general log level and log verbosity is a finer-grained level that only applies to the VERBOSE log severity in debug builds.

For example, see these C API functions:
[SetSessionLogSeverityLevel](https://onnxruntime.ai/docs/api/c/struct_ort_api.html#ac364c1ca9e610962ba96c37112a36d3e)
[SetSessionLogVerbosityLevel](https://onnxruntime.ai/docs/api/c/struct_ort_api.html#ac346615876bbc53dc8aaf17acfe36b94)

Some things to consider:
How do the environment variables interact with the other ways of setting the log levels? At what scopes do they apply? What precedence do they have?

Some places to start looking:
Logging code:
https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/tree/master/include/onnxruntime/core/common/logging
https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/tree/master/onnxruntime/core/common/logging
https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/blob/28ce2a5a785804d6244d78274c6fbbda06f48b57/onnxruntime/core/common/logging/logging.cc#L84
https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/blob/28ce2a5a785804d6244d78274c6fbbda06f48b57/onnxruntime/core/common/logging/logging.cc#L148

C API (used to implement some other language APIs):
https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/blob/master/include/onnxruntime/core/session/onnxruntime_c_api.h
https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/blob/master/onnxruntime/core/session/onnxruntime_c_api.cc

Python API (implemented independently of the C API):
https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/blob/master/onnxruntime/python/onnxruntime_pybind_state.cc

Thanks for your interest in contributing. Feel free to discuss and ask questions here.
